revised_title: A. G. Cock's Role in the International Research Council and the International Mathematical Union
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > History of Science
tldr: This article discusses the confusion surrounding A. G. Cock's paper "Chauvinism in Science" and the roles of W. B. Hardy and G. H. Hardy in the International Research Council and the International Mathematical Union. It also highlights the international diplomacy of G. H. Hardy and Gosta Mittag-Leffler during World War I and the formation of the International Mathematical Union.
